thread.title: Younis Khan eclipses Javed Miandad’s record, becomes Pakistan's top run-getter
thread.title_full: Younis Khan eclipses Javed Miandad’s record, becomes Pakistan's top run-getter

author: PTI
title: Younis Khan eclipses Javed Miandad’s record, becomes Pakistan's top run-getter
text:
PTI | October 13, 2015, 19.10 pm IST Younis (38) though could not stay at the crease for long after getting out to Stuart Broad. But his 8852 runs stand tall in Pakistan cricket. (Photo: ICC) Abu Dhabi : Veteran batsman Younis Khan on Tuesday became Pakistan's all-time leading Test run-scorer, surpassing Javed Miandad's tally of 8832 runs on the opening day of the first Test against England here.
Congratulations to Younus Khan on becoming Pakistan's all-time leading runs scorer in Test cricket - Pakistan Cricket Team
Posted by ICC - International Cricket Council on Tuesday, October 13, 2015 Playing his 102nd Test, Younis, 37, hit off-spinner Moeen Ali for a huge six to cross Miandad and Inzamam-ul-Haq's (8830) score in one stroke. Younis (38) though could not stay at the crease for long after getting out to Stuart Broad. But his 8852 runs stand tall in Pakistan cricket.
An outstanding cricketer goes past the great Javed Miandad. So it is. Younis Khan. Delighted for him.
— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) October 13, 2015 While Miandad, who held on to his aggregate for 22 long years, played 124 matches with an average of 52.57, Inzamam fell short of the record by 2 runs in his final Test (120) against South Africa in 2007.
Congratulation to Younis Khan on becoming a Highest run scorer for Pakistan in Test matches #PAKvENG #DreamGreen pic.twitter.com/h7CaMslPAt
— PCB Official (@TheRealPCB) October 13, 2015 India's batting legend Sachin Tendulkar holds the record for most Test runs, with 15,921 in a record 200 matches.
